subject: fix(interest-form): detect API-not-deployed and show actionable errors
body:
Root cause: Vercel logs show all requests to /api/send-interest return
404 — the API serverless functions are not deployed. Vercel serves 404
without CORS headers, so the browser throws "TypeError: Failed to fetch"
which is indistinguishable from a network failure on mobile Chrome.

Three changes:

1. DebugBanner diagnostics: Add "API Deployed" check that hits the
   /api/health endpoint before checking CORS. When health returns 404,
   the diagnostic clearly shows "API not deployed — redeploy with:
   cd api && npx vercel --prod". CORS check is skipped when not deployed
   to avoid a confusing secondary failure.

2. InterestForm error handling: Replace single CORS probe with
   three-phase diagnoseFailure() that distinguishes not-deployed (health
   endpoint 404), CORS misconfigured (health OK but form fetch blocked),
   and network failure (server unreachable). Each gets a specific
   user-facing message.

3. api/vercel.json: Remove legacy "builds" configuration in favor of
   Vercel zero-config auto-detection. The legacy format can cause
   deployment issues and is no longer needed for the api/ directory
   structure.
